title: The Day Bob Saw Jesus
features: Bob was known as the second-grade bully and took pride in knowing that his classmates were afraid of him.His teacher, Mrs. Rose, prayed that she would know what to do. She told Bob that each day Jesus gives us is a chance to start anew.Bob still didn't care. To him, Jesus was just an imaginary man.
description: The Day Bob Saw Jesus by Lindi Juarez ★★★★★         BY  R.C. GIBSON / JANUARY 27, 2021 A stirring and emotional picture book that highlights the value of prayer.At school, Bob is a self-proclaimed bully who picks on his fellow second-grade classmates, pulling their hair, tripping them, shoving them, and the like. He takes pride in his punishments and is never helpful or friendly. His teacher, Mrs. Rose, is a Christian with a love for Jesus and for her students, and she prays for Bob. The next morning, Bob has a vision of Jesus at his school, lovingly watching all the students and their actions toward each other. As Bob observes how Jesus treats the students kindly and lovingly, Bob's heart is touched and filled with grace and he begins a transformation that will change his very life course.Every school has students like Bob. And whether it is patient and caring teachers or fellow students, every school has Christians that are praying for misguided children. The Day Bob Saw Jesus is a stirring and emotional picture book that highlights the value of prayer, forgiveness, and the love of the Christ. The full-page artwork is exquisite, not overshadowing the book's powerful message, but instead enhancing it and making it more attractive to youths. This book teaches young ones valuable Christian qualities, and it can also strengthen their faith and fill them with hope. Lindi Juarez shows that she knows her audience well and has great respect and faith while looking to share the gospel with youths in a warm manner that will undoubtedly touch their hearts.

LINDI JUAREZ calls reading and writing her passion, specifically books that seek to touch the hearts of children. Her belief that all children are precious in the eyes of God is evident in her writings that focus on the goodness of every child. She has been a teacher for over 25 years and has witnessed how believing and trusting in Jesus from a very young age can make a lasting impact. Ms. Juarez was born and raised in Texas, has three daughters and four grandchildren. She currently lives in Pearland, Texas with her husband.Mai was born in Long Beach, CA in 1981 and raised in Huntington Beach, CA. She graduated from Cal State University, Long Beach in 2005 with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Illustration. She is also a member of the Society of Children's Book Writers & Illustrators (SCBWI) since winning the Illustrator Contest for Crusin' in 2007 and was also one of their Featured Artists in 2008. Since then, she has illustrated several picture books with various publishers.Mai currently lives in Lancaster, CA with her husband Joshua Kemble (Xeric Grant Winner for NUMB/comic book artist/designer/illustrator), their son, and two dogs.
